bullets.text: U.S. November jobs report: payrolls +64,000; unemployment 4.6%, little changed—signals soft but stable labor market after October decline.
Fed ends enforcement actions against Goldman Sachs and Metropolitan Commercial Bank, reducing regulatory overhang and signaling remediation completion.
U.S. crude settles at lowest since early 2021 on looming surplus, pressuring energy revenues and inflation expectations.
Trump orders blockade of sanctioned Venezuelan oil tankers and labels Venezuela a terrorist regime, raising regional tensions and oil-market disruption risk.
Trump expands travel ban/restrictions to 20 more countries, heightening diplomatic friction and potentially affecting immigration, tourism, and cross-border business flows.
Ukraine security plan emphasizes enhanced forces with U.S./European backing, implying long-term Western commitments and continued defense-industrial demand.
France passes welfare budget law, a rare legislative win that may reduce near-term political risk around fiscal governance.
Japan exports post fastest growth in nine months, beating expectations—supports growth outlook and highlights resilience in external demand.
Trump signals strong consideration of cannabis rescheduling; pot stocks rally as investors price expanded medical research, banking access, and broader commercialization.
Tesla shares hit record on robotaxi optimism, but California judge finds deceptive Autopilot/FSD marketing—raising legal, regulatory, and reputational risks.
Waymo reportedly seeks $15B funding round, signaling escalating capital needs for autonomous mobility and sustained investor appetite despite long commercialization timelines.
Databricks raises $4B at $134B valuation, underscoring robust private-market pricing for enterprise AI data platforms.
Pfizer cuts revenue forecast and offers modest 2026 outlook, highlighting near-term earnings pressure while large acquisitions and pipeline bets mature.
Study suggests ~40% of fMRI signals may be non-neural artifacts, implying neuroscience findings may require recalibration and improved measurement/analysis methods.
Quantum tensor-network methods may compress AI models, potentially lowering compute costs and energy use for training/inference if scalable to production workloads.
